intro: Lobelia flaccida subsp. granvikii, commonly known as the granvikii lobelia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky outcrops and forested areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
